byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sofia Perpetua from Salvador, Vinod Sreeharsha from Rio de Janeiro, Donald G. McNeil Jr. from New York, and Sabrina Tavernise from Washington.

abstract: Conspiracy theories about origins of Zika virus are spreading throughout Brazil, fueled by fear and lack of understanding of infection thought to be behind wave of birth defects there; rumors, which in some cases have undermined efforts to combat disease, are frustrating government and health authorities.
lead_paragraph: Rumors have replicated through social media and word of mouth, frustrating Brazilian officials as they grapple with a mysterious pathogen.

headline.main: Conspiracy Theories About Zika Spread Through Brazil With the Virus
headline.print_headline: Conspiracy Theories About Zika Spread Through Brazil With the Virus

snippet: Rumors have replicated through social media and word of mouth, frustrating Brazilian officials as they grapple with a mysterious pathogen.
